data.title: Knight vs Queen
data.statement:
<<Chess Rules>>
The queen (Q) "sees" squares 8-directionally from the square it is placed on. On the other hand, the knight (K) can only manoeuvre 2 squares in one cardinal direction and 1 square in the orthogonal cardinal direction. Both pieces may not "see" / move to squares outside of the chessboard.

The figure below depicts the sight of both the queen and knight on a chessboard, with the "x" denoting which square(s) the queen/knight can "see" / move to respectively.

```   a b c d e f g h        a b c d e f g h 
8 |x|_|_|x|_|_|x|_|    8 |_|_|_|_|_|_|_|_|
7 |_|x|_|x|_|x|_|_|    7 |_|_|x|_|x|_|_|_|
6 |_|_|x|x|x|_|_|_|    6 |_|x|_|_|_|x|_|_|
5 |x|x|x|Q|x|x|x|x|    5 |_|_|_|K|_|_|_|_|
4 |_|_|x|x|x|_|_|_|    4 |_|x|_|_|_|x|_|_|
3 |_|x|_|x|_|x|_|_|    3 |_|_|x|_|x|_|_|_|
2 |x|_|_|x|_|_|x|_|    2 |_|_|_|_|_|_|_|_|
1 |_|_|_|x|_|_|_|x|    1 |_|_|_|_|_|_|_|_|```
<<Objective>>
A queen and a knight are placed onto an 8x8 chessboard. You are given the initial positions of the queen ([[qPos]]) and knight ([[kPos]]). You are also given a sequence of [[N]] positions ([[nPos]]) corresponding to knight moves. Determine whether the knight can manoeuvre successfully around the chessboard without being "seen" by the queen.

testCases.title: Simple Moves
testCases.testIn:
d5 f6
3
e8
c7
a6
testCases.testOut: Knight successfully manoeuvred from f6 to a6

data.constraints:
0 ≤ [[N]] < 500
[[qPos]], [[kPos]], and all [[nPos]] are valid chess notations
[[qPos]] ≠ [[kPos]] and [[qPos]] ≠ all [[nPos]]
data.stubGenerator:
read qPos:word(2) kPos:word(2)
read n:int
loop n read nPos:word(2)
write Knight attempting invalid move from <?> to <?>
Queen sees knight on <?>
Knight successfully manoeuvred from <?> to <?>
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: Two space-separated strings [[qPos]] and [[kPos]], both in chess notation.
<<Line 2>>: A non-negative integer [[N]].
<<Next [[N]] lines>>: [[nPos]], given in chess notation.

Chess notation refers to the format "[[col]][[row]]" where [[col]] is a letter {{a}}-{{h}} and [[row]] is a number {{1}}-{{8}} (e.g. h6, b5, c1, d7, etc.). Each notation refers to a specific position on the chessboard.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: One of the following statements:

- If the knight attempts to make an invalid move, stop the manoeuvring sequence. Output "{{Knight attempting invalid move from}} [[prevPos]] {{to}} [[nPos]]", where [[prevPos]] is the last valid position of the knight and [[nPos]] refers to the invalid move in the sequence.

- Else, if the knight moves to any square "seen" by the queen, stop the manoeuvring sequence. Output "{{Queen sees knight on}} [[nPos]]", where [[nPos]] refers to the square the knight moved to.

- Else, the knight should be able to complete its manoeuvring sequence. Output "{{Knight successfully manoeuvred from}} [[kPos]] {{to}} [[nPos]]", where [[kPos]] is the initial knight position and [[nPos]] is the final knight position.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Chess Rules
The queen (Q) "sees" squares 8-directionally from the square it is placed on. On the other hand, the knight (K) can only manoeuvre 2 squares in one cardinal direction and 1 square in the orthogonal cardinal direction. Both pieces may not "see" / move to squares outside of the chessboard.

The figure below depicts the sight of both the queen and knight on a chessboard, with the "x" denoting which square(s) the queen/knight can "see" / move to respectively.

   a b c d e f g h        a b c d e f g h 
8 |x|_|_|x|_|_|x|_|    8 |_|_|_|_|_|_|_|_|
7 |_|x|_|x|_|x|_|_|    7 |_|_|x|_|x|_|_|_|
6 |_|_|x|x|x|_|_|_|    6 |_|x|_|_|_|x|_|_|
5 |x|x|x|Q|x|x|x|x|    5 |_|_|_|K|_|_|_|_|
4 |_|_|x|x|x|_|_|_|    4 |_|x|_|_|_|x|_|_|
3 |_|x|_|x|_|x|_|_|    3 |_|_|x|_|x|_|_|_|
2 |x|_|_|x|_|_|x|_|    2 |_|_|_|_|_|_|_|_|
1 |_|_|_|x|_|_|_|x|    1 |_|_|_|_|_|_|_|_|

Objective
A queen and a knight are placed onto an 8x8 chessboard. You are given the initial positions of the queen (qPos) and knight (kPos). You are also given a sequence of N positions (nPos) corresponding to knight moves. Determine whether the knight can manoeuvre successfully around the chessboard without being "seen" by the queen.




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: Two space-separated strings qPos and kPos, both in chess notation.
Line 2: A non-negative integer N.
Next N lines: nPos, given in chess notation.

Chess notation refers to the format "colrow" where col is a letter a-h and row is a number 1-8 (e.g. h6, b5, c1, d7, etc.). Each notation refers to a specific position on the chessboard.

   

   

      
Output

      
Line 1: One of the following statements:

- If the knight attempts to make an invalid move, stop the manoeuvring sequence. Output "Knight attempting invalid move from prevPos to nPos", where prevPos is the last valid position of the knight and nPos refers to the invalid move in the sequence.

- Else, if the knight moves to any square "seen" by the queen, stop the manoeuvring sequence. Output "Queen sees knight on nPos", where nPos refers to the square the knight moved to.

- Else, the knight should be able to complete its manoeuvring sequence. Output "Knight successfully manoeuvred from kPos to nPos", where kPos is the initial knight position and nPos is the final knight position.

   

   

      
Constraints

      
0 ≤ N < 500
qPos, kPos, and all nPos are valid chess notations
qPos ≠ kPos and qPos ≠ all nPos

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
d5 f6
3
e8
c7
a6

         

         

            
Output

            
Knight successfully manoeuvred from f6 to a6
